Of course, it will also evolve during time."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"That being said, I do think there are many essential elements that are often missing from front-end US and I do want to talk about them."}]},{"type":"heading","level":2,"children":[{"type":"span","value":"User interaction"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"It's really easy to forget to showcase user interactions on a mockup. Be sure to collaborate with the UX / UI designers on that."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"Also, don't forget to handle the focus. Some approaches like building a design system may help you remember to handle those states."}]},{"type":"heading","level":2,"children":[{"type":"span","value":"Sad path"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"When something can fail, you need to know how to handle the error. When you make an API call for example, it is very likely that this call will fail at some point."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"If we are fetching some data to display, what should we display instead? If the user was trying to perform an action, how can we interpret the failure to display a meaningful error message? How is this message styled? Or maybe we can recover from the error by doing something else or performing an automatic retry?"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"Let's take an example: a single field where the user can type its email address to subscribe to a newsletter. The email format can be invalid: how can we display this error to the user? Once validated, the user may have lost network connection, how can we indicate that? Or maybe the call can fail server-side, either because there is a random error, or because the user is already registered. In this last case, should we display an error to the user? Or maybe confirm the subscription without notifying that he was already registered? This is a business decision, not only a technical one."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"The sad path is something really easy to forget, leading to interfaces that seems broken or not responding, which can cause a lot of frustration to your users."}]},{"type":"heading","level":2,"children":[{"type":"span","value":"Empty states"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"Even when there is no error, some calls may return empty results. In this particular example, maybe the user don't know how to add favorite movies? Replacing the empty screen with guidance may be the move to improve your user experience."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"type":"span","value":"Sometimes, you have temporary empty states, for example when you're loading the data or performing an action.
